sections.title: The growing challenge of financial fraud
sections.content:
Financial institutions face constant evolution in fraud tactics. One increasingly sophisticated method involves systematically circumventing withdrawal limits by distributing transactions across multiple accounts or timeframes, often simulating legitimate activity. Off-the-shelf fraud detection systems often struggle to identify these nuanced patterns, leading to significant losses and regulatory risks.

Building a custom detection tool allows you to tailor the system to your specific organizational data, risk profiles, and business rules, providing a level of precision and adaptability that generic solutions simply cannot match.

sections.title: Why custom detection is crucial for financial security
sections.content:
## Limitations of standard fraud systems

Many existing fraud detection platforms are designed for common fraud types like unauthorized transactions or identity theft. They often fall short when it comes to subtle, pattern-based circumvention schemes because they:

- **Lack granular transaction analysis**: Inability to connect disparate transactions across multiple accounts or entities.
- **Are rule-based and rigid**: Struggle to adapt to new circumvention methods not covered by predefined rules.
- **Generate high false positives**: Alert on legitimate customer behavior due to broad, untargeted rules.
- **Lag in real-time detection**: Process data with delays, allowing fraudulent activities to complete before flagging.
- **Offer limited customization**: Cannot be tailored to specific financial products, customer segments, or internal risk appetites.

## The power of a bespoke solution

Developing a custom withdrawal limit circumvention detection system using Kliv gives your institution a significant edge:

### Adaptive and intelligent detection
Leverage machine learning to identify complex, evolving patterns that indicate circumvention. The system learns from historical data and adapts to new fraud vectors, minimizing false negatives.

### Cross-account and entity linkage
Go beyond single-account analysis. A custom solution can link transactions and behaviors across related accounts, individuals, and even external entities, revealing the full scope of a circumvention attempt.

### Real-time, proactive intervention
Build a system capable of analyzing transactions in real-time, allowing for immediate alerts and interventions, significantly reducing potential losses.

### Customized risk scoring
Develop a risk scoring model that precisely reflects your institution's unique risk parameters, allowing for highly accurate prioritization of alerts.

### Regulatory compliance and auditability
Ensure your detection mechanisms meet specific regulatory requirements and provide detailed audit trails for every flagged activity.

## Real-world impact

Custom detection systems can revolutionize your fraud prevention efforts:

**Banking**: Identify sequences of ATM withdrawals or online transfers across multiple family accounts designed to stay below daily limits.

**Wealth Management**: Detect strategic withdrawals from different investment accounts or portfolios by a single actor to avoid reporting thresholds.

**Payment Processors**: Uncover systematic small-value transactions across diverse merchant accounts to launder funds under reporting limits.

**Lending Institutions**: Identify borrowers manipulating multiple small loan applications to cumulatively exceed an internal lending cap.

## Why Kliv empowers this capability

Kliv's AI-powered platform makes developing such a sophisticated system accessible without extensive in-house data science or engineering teams. You can define the logic, data sources, and analytical needs, and the AI assists in building the complex infrastructure required for high-volume, real-time fraud detection.

- **Rapid development**: Go from concept to deployment in weeks, not months.
- **Scalable architecture**: Design a system that grows with your transaction volume.
- **Data integration flexibility**: Connect to diverse internal and external data sources.
- **Secure by design**: Implement robust security protocols tailored to financial data.

Invest in a solution that truly understands and addresses the specific threats your institution faces.

sections.title: Detection system ideas to get you started

items.description: Flag coordinated ATM withdrawals exceeding daily limits across linked accounts.
items.prompt: Create a real-time system that monitors ATM withdrawal patterns across all customer accounts linked by address, SSN, or phone number. Alert if the aggregate daily withdrawal amount exceeds a set threshold, even if individual account withdrawals are below their limits.
items.title: ATM Withdrawal Aggregation Detector

items.description: Identify structured online transfers to multiple beneficiaries below suspicious transaction limits.
items.prompt: Build a module that analyzes online bank transfers to different external beneficiaries. Detect if multiple small transfers, when aggregated, exceed a suspicious activity report (SAR) threshold within a 24-hour period, especially if beneficiaries share common traits or locations.
items.title: Multi-Beneficiary Transfer Anomaly

items.description: Spot repeated, small-value card transactions at the same merchant by different cards from one entity.
items.prompt: Develop a system to identify credit/debit card use where multiple cards belonging to the same individual or entity make repeated small purchases, staying below individual transaction reporting limits, at the same merchant within a short timeframe.
items.title: Structured Card Transaction Monitor

items.description: Detect attempts to circumvent limits by opening numerous small accounts.
items.prompt: Design a system to flag individuals or groups attempting to open multiple new accounts, each with small initial deposits, and then using them for coordinated, small-value transactions to collectively exceed an internal monitoring threshold.
items.title: New Account Pattern Analyzer
